casebody.data:
ABRONS FAMILY PRACTICE & URGENT CARE, PA, et al.
v.
NC DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH & HUMAN SERVICES, et al. 427A16-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 23, 2017 Camden R. Webb, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Abrons Family Practice and Urgent Care, PA, et al. Amar Majmundar, Special Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Assistant Attorney General, for North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services Jennifer K. Van Zant, Bryan Starrett, Greensboro, Charles F. Marshall, III, Elizabeth Connolly Stone, Raleigh, Attorneys at Law, for Computer Sciences Corporation Mark S. Thomas, Attorney at Law Matthew Jordan Cochran, Thomas E. Cone, Greensboro, Curtis B. Venable, Stephen J. White, Attorneys at Law, for Charlotte-Mecklenburg Hospital Authority, et al. Morgan, J.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 19th of May 2017 by Plaintiffs:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 23rd of May 2017."

Plaintiffs shall have up to and including the 2nd day of June 2017 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
